p: A new human coronavirus named SARS-CoV-2 was identified in several cases of acute respiratory syndrome in Wuhan, China in December 2019 [ 1, 2]. The transmission pathways of the new coronavirus include direct transmission (coughing, sneezing and inhalation transmission of droplets) and transmission by contact with mucosa [ 3]. The viral load of SARS-CoV-2 in saliva can exceed 1 × 10 8 viral copies per milliliter [ 4] both in symptomatic and asymptomatic positive subjects [ 5].
